summary: Email correspondence between FBI personnel and a forensic accountant regarding the transmission of financial records obtained via subpoenas to Deutsche Bank and American Express in the Epstein investigation. The emails discuss logistics for sharing approximately 20 returns and a 5 GB production from Deutsche Bank.

persons.name: M Meine
persons.context: Appears as the sender of an email coordinating receipt of subpoenaed financial records from Deutsche Bank and American Express.

persons.name: Ori
persons.context: Mentioned as a paralegal who can help facilitate transmission of Deutsche Bank materials via USAFx and provide the full current production.

connections.description: M Meine references Ori (paralegal) as being cc'd and able to assist with transmitting Deutsche Bank materials.

events.title: Email coordination for subpoenaed records
events.description: Email exchange regarding logistics for sharing financial records obtained via subpoenas from Deutsche Bank and American Express, including plans to transmit a 5 GB Deutsche Bank production.

events.title: Subpoenas issued to Deutsche Bank and American Express
events.description: Subpoenas were issued to Deutsche Bank and American Express (AmEx) for financial records related to the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: Subpoenas were issued to Deutsche Bank and American Express (AmEx) on July 11, 2019, for financial records in the Epstein investigation.
The Deutsche Bank production was approximately 5 GB in size, indicating a substantial volume of financial records.
The FBI was coordinating receipt of approximately 20 returns from these subpoenas that they had not yet received.
Communication shows active investigation into Epstein's finances as of October 2019, months after his death in August 2019.
